title: Asymptotic Density
content: d(A) = lim_{N→∞} |A ∩ [1,N]|/N. The natural measure of 'how thick' a set of integers is.

title: Sumset A + B
content: A + B = {a + b : a ∈ A, b ∈ B}. The sumset inherits structure from A and B.

title: Density Additivity
content: d(A+B) = d(A) + d(B): the sumset density is exactly the sum of the individual densities. Much stronger than Plünnecke–Ruzsa.

title: Fractional Part Sets
content: A = {n > 0 : {nθ} ∈ X} for irrational θ and measurable X ⊆ [0,1). By Weyl, d(A) = μ(X).

title: Main Conjecture
content: All density-additive pairs arise from group rotation constructions: A = {n : orbit of g in G meets X_A}.

title: Plünnecke–Ruzsa Lower Bound
content: d(A+B) ≥ min(d(A)+d(B), 1). Density additivity means this bound is achieved with equality.

title: Tightness Theorem
content: Density additivity implies d(A+B) = min(d(A)+d(B), 1). Proved from the sum constraint d(A)+d(B) ≤ 1.

title: Weyl Equidistribution
content: For irrational θ, the sequence {nθ} is equidistributed mod 1, so fractional part sets have well-defined density equal to the measure of the target set.
